author: Special Correspondent
text:
A day after a cow protector died by consuming pesticide in Rajkot, the Congress demanded that cow be declared “Rashtra Mata” in Gujarat. Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly Shankarsinh Vaghela raised the issue in the House and asked the government why it did not concede the demands of the cow protectors and animal rights activists.

“The BJP has been playing politics over cow for decades, but it is not at all interested in protecting cows, which are being slaughtered in the State. What prevents the BJP from declaring cow a ‘Rashtra Mata’ when it is in power in the State and at the Centre,” he asked. “Eight persons consumed poison in the Collector office and one person died because the government had never conceded their demands,” he said.
title: Cong. wants cow declared ‘Rashtra Mata’ in Gujarat
